title: Droping objects
body:
There are scenes in which the character after grabbing an object does not drop it. Is this a bug or am I doing something wrong when defining the actions?

In the following script the behavior mentioned occurs, if for example I run a similar script in scene 4 it drops it, but in scene 5 it fails to putback: 

```python
...

comm.reset(5)

...

coffeemaker = find_nodes(graph, class_name='coffeemaker')[-1]
coffeepot = find_nodes(graph, class_name='coffeepot')[-1]
kitchentable = find_nodes(graph, class_name='kitchentable')[-1]
tv = find_nodes(graph, class_name='tv')[-1]
microwave = find_nodes(graph, class_name='microwave')[-1]
script3 = ['<char0> [Walk] <microwave> ({})'.format(microwave['id']),
          '<char0> [Walk] <coffeemaker> ({})'.format(coffeemaker['id']),
          '<char0> [Walk] <coffeepot> ({})'.format(coffeepot['id']),
          '<char0> [Grab] <coffeepot> ({})'.format(coffeepot['id']),
          '<char0> [Walk] <kitchentable> ({})'.format(kitchentable['id']),
          '<char0> [Putback] <coffeepot> ({}) <kitchentable> ({})'.format(coffeepot['id'], kitchentable['id']),
          '<char0> [Walk] <tv> ({})'.format(tv['id'])]


success, message = comm.render_script(script=script3,
                                     processing_time_limit=120,
                                     find_solution=False,
                                     image_width=320,
                                     image_height=240,
                                     skip_animation=False,
                                     recording=True,
                                     save_pose_data=True,
                                     file_name_prefix='make-a-coffee2')
```
